intro: Dyssodia tenuiloba subsp. wrightii, commonly known as Wright's slender dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. This subspecies is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Dyssodia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
